etymologies: mid 18th century: from Latin, from con- ‘together with’ + genus, gener- ‘race, stock’

definitions: a thing or person of the same kind or category as another.
shortDefinitions: thing or person of same kind or category as another

definitions: an animal or plant of the same genus as another

examples.text: these birds or their congeners may be found in East Africa

shortDefinitions: animal or plant of same genus as another

definitions: a minor chemical constituent, especially one that gives a distinctive character to a wine or liquor or is responsible for some of its physiological effects.
